title: CCRA Unveils The Top 10 Cities For Fall Travel in the U.S. and Abroad
text:
CCRA’s Fall 2015 Travel Trends Are Based On Travel Agent Hotel Bookings Made Through CCRA’s Commissionable Hotel Booking Engine
Fort Worth, Texas (PRWEB) September 17, 2015
CCRA Travel Commerce Network – a global hub for travel technology, marketing, accreditation and education – today announced the top ten domestic and international fall 2015 vacation destinations based on travel agent bookings made through the CCRATravel.com hotel booking engine. The quarterly CCRA travel trend report provides useful information on where consumers who seek travel professionals’ services are planning to vacation in the U.S. and abroad, and reveals several new destinations that consumers are planning to visit this upcoming fall travel season compared to fall 2014 bookings.
The following ten domestic and international cities have received the greatest number of hotel bookings to-date from travel professionals through the CCRATravel.com hotel booking engine for fall arrivals between September 23rd through December 21st, 2015:
The Top 10 U.S. Cities For Fall 2015 Hotel Stays:
1. Las Vegas, NV
2. Orlando, FL
3. Miami, FL
4. New Orleans, LA
5. New York, NY
6. Fort Lauderdale, FL
7. San Diego, CA
8. Anaheim, CA
9. Key West, FL ** NEW
10. Nashville, TN ** NEW
The Top 10 International Cities For Fall 2015 Hotel Stays:
1. Reykjavik, IS
2. Paris, France
3. San Juan, PR **NEW
4. Venice, IT
5. Rome, IT
6. Rockhampton, AU **NEW
7. Barcelona, ES
8. Montego Bay, JM **NEW
9. London, GB
10. Florence, IT
Based on CCRA’s year-over-year 2014/2015 hotel booking comparisons, the following two new cities appear on CCRA’s Top 10 U.S. Cities list for 2015 fall arrivals: Key West, FL and Nashville, TN. Additionally, the following three new cities appear on CCRA’s Top 10 International Cities list: San Juan, Puerto Rico; Rockhampton, Australia; and Montego Bay, Jamaica.
“Our CCRATravel.com hotel booking engine allows travel agents to pass along incredible savings to their clients offered by our growing number of over 180,000 preferred hotel suppliers, when arranging trips to these trending fall vacation destinations,” said Dic Marxen, President and CEO of CCRA Travel Commerce Network. “We recently announced plans to significantly enhance our CCRATravel.com hotel booking engine scheduled to re-launch this Winter 2015/16, as part of our continued commitment to help travel professionals earn higher commissions while providing their clients with the best hotel rates and added value offers available. Travel professionals will benefit from the hotel booking engine’s new and modernized look, enhanced functionality and user experience, and an increased hotel inventory worldwide.”
CCRATravel.com currently provides individual travel professionals and travel agencies with access to real-time inventory at over 180,000 hotels worldwide, and the ability to select from a variety of different rate categories on a single search. Scheduled to re-launch in Winter 2015/16, the new and modernized hotel booking engine will still offer the same CCRA commissionable rate categories and will remain free for qualified travel agents to use, but it will also feature state-of-the-art reservations and booking technology, easy to read “at-a-glance” information and richer hotel descriptions, faster navigation, an increased hotel inventory, and more flexible payment options. To register to use the CCRATravel.com hotel booking engine, travel agents and agencies may visit: http://www.ccratravel.com/app/register/register.aspx .
ABOUT CCRA:
Based in Ft. Worth, Texas, CCRA Travel Commerce Network is a global hub for travel technology, marketing, accreditation and education. For over forty years, CCRA has connected travel professionals and suppliers with the products and services they need to drive revenue, relationships and brand recognition in the travel marketplace. From the TRUE accreditation and coding system to hotels, air, call center services and more, CCRA is truly where the travel industry connects. For more information, visit http://www.ccra.com .
